definition: to twirl (in the fingers)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud
Nian Army, leading a peasant rebellion against the Qing dynasty in Shandong, Henan, Jiangsu and Anhui 1851-1868, at the same time as the Taiping Rebellion further south

sentences.english: All the hangings enclosing the court were of fine twined linen.
sentences.chinese: 庭院四周所有的帷幔，都是用捻的细麻编成的。
却任心事满园，亦捻花不语。

sentences.english: The man was twiddling with his moustaches.
sentences.chinese: 那个男子在捻弄着小胡子。

sentences.english: Woven Rovings are fiberglass fabric woven of direct rovings.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃纤维布或称方格布是由直接无捻粗纱机织而成。

sentences.english: Crepitus and air bubbles at Stensen's duct with palpation may be observed at physical examination.
sentences.chinese: 体格检查时可以触及捻发音和腮腺导管内气泡。

sentences.english: The south side shall be a hundred cubits long and is to have curtains of finely twisted linen
sentences.chinese: 院子的南面要用捻的细麻做帷子，长一百肘。

sentences.english: She saw Manya twiddling a young green chestnut leaf under her nose.
sentences.chinese: 她看到玛尼娅在鼻子底下捻弄着一片新绿的栗树叶子。

sentences.english: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
sentences.chinese: 院子四面的帷子都是用捻的细麻作的。

sentences.english: All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen.
sentences.chinese: 院子四面的帷子都是用捻的细麻做的。

sentences.english: She turned the wick down, lifted off the globe, and breathed onthe sulky flame.
sentences.chinese: 她把灯芯捻低，取下灯罩，对着发蔫的火头哈了口气。

sentences.english: Also, it is more uniform but somewhat weaker than ring- spun yarn.
sentences.chinese: 另外，无捻纱比环锭纱条干更均匀，强度则略低。

sentences.english: Often yarns are too fine to allow the unaided eyes to discern the twist direction.
sentences.chinese: 纱线通常因为太细使得肉眼很难识别其捻向。

sentences.english: If you want an automobile with a twist, look no further than the Peugeot OXO .
sentences.chinese: 如果您想要一个汽车与一捻，不要再观望，比标致氧。

sentences.english: Twist one shredded paper ink, put a sentiment, in the impression the drafting of old Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 捻一纸碎墨，揣一份情愫，在印象里起草旧时的柏林。

sentences.english: The closer the previous friendship, the easier it is to get reacquainted.
sentences.chinese: 之前的友情愈亲近，再度熟捻起来就愈容易。

definition: to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to hold sth long and run one's hand along it
to smooth or arrange sth using one's fingers/to stroke
(coll.) to remove (crinkles, dirt) with the palm of the hand
to stroke/to caress
variant of 摩挲[mo2 suo1]
to nip/to grasp with the fingers/to fiddle with/Taiwan pr. [nian2]
finger/toe/CL:個|个[ge4]
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
to scratch/old variant of 騷|骚[sao1]
to stroke/to caress
to stroke lightly/to caress
lightly/softly
to weigh in the hand/to estimate
fingertip/finger
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
index finger/mouths to feed
